section.p: The procedures in this chapter instruct you to create temporary variables that are used as building blocks for accurately constructing configuration variables. You append the variables to /etc/default/serviced, and then edit the file to move the variables to more appropriate locations.

The most important temporary variables specify the IPv4 address of each host in the ZooKeeper ensemble. The following table identifies these important variables, the names and values of which must be identical on every cluster host.

row.entry: IPv4 address of the master host
IPv4 address of delegate host A
IPv4 address of delegate host B

section.note: All ensemble hosts should be on the same subnet.
